text: George Woodruff Mitchell (September 19, 1822 – February 16, 1908) was a member of the Wisconsin State Senate as a Democrat. Mitchell represented the 20th District during the 1862 and 1863 sessions. He was born in St. Albans, Vermont"United States Census, 1850," database with images, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:M4D2-RWJ : 9 November 2014), G W Mitchell, Plover, Portage, Wisconsin, United States; citing family 11, NARA microfilm publication M432 (Washington, D.C.: National Archives and Records Administration, n.d.)."United States Census, 1860", database with images, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:MWMB-694 : 30 December 2015), George W Mitchel, 1860. and lived in Ripon, Wisconsin in the 1860s. He was also involved in the lumber and life insurance businesses. He died in Milwaukee and was buried there at Forest Home Cemetery. ==References== ==External links== *The Political Graveyard * Category:People from St. Albans, Vermont Category:Wisconsin Democrats Category:Wisconsin state senators Category:1822 births Category:1908 deaths Category:People from Ripon, Wisconsin
title: George Mitchell (Wisconsin politician)
